title: First Look at USAF C-32 in New VIP Livery Destined for the VC-25B
description: A freshly repainted C-32A shows off the livery redesign long favored by President Donald Trump, which is also due to appear on the next generation of Presidential aircraft. Boeing C-32A 99-0003 was recently noted by aviation enthusiasts flying from Greenville Majors Airport (KGVT), where the fleet undergoes periodic maintenance overhauls and upgrades with L3Harris, in []

title: Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: January 26–February 1, 2026
description:
Israel continued military operations in Lebanon between January 26 and February 1, 2026. Israeli activities were concentrated in south Lebanon and continued to target Hezbollah assets and personnel, despite the Lebanese Armed Forces claiming to have taken operational control of the South Litani Area earlier this month.
The post Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: January 26–February 1, 2026 appeared first on FDDs Long War Journal.

title: Rafah crossing opens days after IDF says Hamas violated ceasefire, conducts strikes
description: The Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt reopened on February 2 for limited pedestrian traffic, marking a key step in the US-backed ceasefire plan that began in October. The move followed significant Israeli airstrikes after the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said that terrorists had emerged from a tunnel in Rafah, violating the ceasefire. The IDF continued operations in Gaza, reporting additional clashes with suspected terrorists and the discovery

title: The revamp of Ireland’s defence
description:
Despite a long-standing policy of neutrality, Ireland has recognised Russia as a threat, and is following Europe in rearmament.
The post The revamp of Ireland’s defence appeared first on Naval Technology.

title: Envoys signal no breakthrough on bridging Russia and Ukraine’s military, political differences
description: The negotiations in Switzerland were the third round of direct talks organized by the U.S. Expectations for significant progress in Geneva were low.

title: US to send more missile launchers to the Philippines despite China’s alarm
description: The addition of missile launchers comes as treaty allies condemned what they called China’s “illegal, coercive, aggressive, and deceptive activities.”

title: Airbus open to two-fighter option for FCAS to keep program alive
description: “The deadlock of a single pillar should not jeopardize the entire future of this high-tech European capability, which will bolster our collective defense."

title: BAE says its Eurofighter pipeline is filled until first GCAP assembly
description: Europe accounted for 32% of the BAE order book at the end of December, while accounting for 11% of sales in 2025, the company said.

title: Pentagon official blesses Europe’s push to spend defense money at home
description: “Otherwise people in Germany or Poland or whatever are going to say: ‘Why are we only sending money across the Atlantic?’” said the Pentagon policy chief.

title: Pentagon to deploy roughly 200 troops to Nigeria
description: The 200 troops will supplement a small team of American military officers already embedded with Nigerian forces.

title: Trans-Atlantic tensions in focus as annual Munich security gathering opens
description: An annual gathering of top international security figures that last year set the tone for a growing rift between the United States and Europe opens Friday.

title: Syria says its forces have taken over al-Tanf base after handover from US
description: The military outpost was run for years by U.S. troops as part of the war against the Islamic State group.

title: Trump’s new national defense strategy downgrades China threat
description: The Pentagon declared on Friday that the U.S. military’s top priority is to defend the homeland and Western Hemisphere.

title: Ukraine’s first underwater drone strike caught on hacked cameras
description: A video on an official government affiliated website reportedly showed the Sub Sea Baby drone striking a part of a Russian Kilo-class submarine.

title: US raid allegedly killed undercover agent instead of IS official
description: A raid by U.S. forces and a Syrian group aiming to capture an Islamic State official instead reportedly killed a local man who was working to gather intel.

title: How the US Army secretary became a key figure in Ukraine peace talks
description: While Driscoll’s role as Army secretary typically involves bureaucratic tasks, he’s also taken on the challenge of diplomacy.

title: Proposed peace plan for Ukraine leaves country in delicate position
description: A U.S. proposal to end the war in Ukraine puts the country in a delicate position — caught between placating the U.S. and not capitulating to Russia.

title: Top US admiral says he’s watching China’s rapid naval buildup closely
description: Adm. Daryl Caudle has called China’s shipbuilding capability “impressive” as Beijing moves ahead with a rapid buildup of the world’s largest navy.

title: Trump says he’ll meet with Putin in Hungary
description: President Donald Trump is redoubling his efforts to end the war in Ukraine, announcing a second meeting with Russia’s Vladimir Putin.

title: Trump says he now thinks Ukraine can win back all land lost to Russia
description: It's a dramatic shift from the U.S. leader’s repeated calls on Kyiv to make concessions to end the war.
